meta.title: Fixnado Privacy Policy
meta.summary: How Fixnado, operated by Blackwellen Ltd, handles personal data across web and mobile and the rights available to you.

sections.title: Introduction
paragraphs: Fixnado is a service orchestration marketplace owned and operated by Blackwellen Ltd. This Privacy Policy describes how we handle personal information when individuals visit our websites, use the Fixnado mobile applications, interact with our communications, or engage with our professional services. It also sets out the safeguards we apply to protect information, the legal bases relied upon for processing, and the controls we make available to customers, providers, and enterprise partners. The Policy supplements any product-specific statements and applies alongside contractual terms agreed with organisations using the Fixnado ecosystem.

Protecting privacy is foundational to our brand and to the trust we maintain with contractors, enterprise buyers, field teams, and consumers. Our compliance program aligns with UK GDPR, EU GDPR, the UK Data Protection Act 2018, and other international regulations that affect Blackwellen Ltd and its subsidiaries. We apply privacy by design and security by default principles across the lifecycle of each product change, and our governance forums review this Policy at least twice annually to ensure it remains accurate, transparent, and ready for operational use.

sections.title: Who we are
paragraphs: Blackwellen Ltd is a private limited company registered in England and Wales (company number 11223344) with its principal place of business at 14 Glasshouse Yard, London, EC1A 4JN, United Kingdom. Blackwellen Ltd is the data controller for the personal information described in this Policy unless a different entity is identified in a specific contract or supplement. Our subsidiaries and trusted resellers may act as data processors when delivering Fixnado services under our direction, and each contract includes privacy, confidentiality, and security obligations that mirror this Policy.

We maintain a designated Data Protection Officer (DPO) and privacy governance office reachable at privacy@fixnado.com. They coordinate regional representatives for the European Union, North America, LATAM, Asia-Pacific, and the Middle East to ensure local regulatory alignment. Blackwellen Ltd has appointed an EU representative under Article 27 GDPR, and we maintain records of processing activities for all Fixnado products. These governance measures ensure the commitments in this Privacy Policy have accountable owners and measurable controls.

sections.title: Scope of this Policy
paragraphs: This Policy applies to personal information processed in connection with the Fixnado web application, the Flutter-based Fixnado mobile application, our communications platforms, marketplace storefronts, bookings and rentals orchestration, analytics dashboards, and associated support channels. It governs how data is handled when users create profiles, browse listings, make or receive bookings, conduct payments through escrow, request support, or integrate Fixnado with enterprise systems.

The Policy does not cover aggregated or anonymised data that can no longer identify a person, nor does it apply to third-party services accessed via integrations where the third party acts as an independent controller. In those scenarios, users should review the privacy statements of the relevant provider. Where Fixnado processes data on behalf of enterprise customers as a processor, the terms of the underlying data processing agreement will prevail, but we still provide this Policy to maintain transparency about our standard practices.

sections.title: Key definitions
paragraphs: When we use the term 'personal data' we mean any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person, including names, contact details, identifiers, location data, or online identifiers. 'Processing' refers to any operation performed on personal data, whether automated or manual, such as collection, recording, organisation, structuring, storage, adaptation, retrieval, consultation, use, disclosure, erasure, or destruction.

'Customers' are enterprise or residential buyers using Fixnado to scope, schedule, or purchase services. 'Providers' are tradespeople, technicians, or companies offering services through Fixnado. 'Partners' are third parties who extend our marketplace, provide logistics, or offer integrations. 'Visitors' are individuals who browse our sites without authenticating. We process data about all these roles, and our role-based access model enforces least privilege across each persona.

sections.title: Privacy governance and accountability
paragraphs: Blackwellen Ltd operates a privacy management framework aligned with ISO/IEC 27701 and integrates privacy risk reviews into our enterprise risk management cycle. Product squads must complete a data protection impact assessment (DPIA) for new or high-risk features and submit the results to the Privacy Office before release. Our legal, compliance, and security teams maintain a joint change control board that reviews policy changes, monitors regulatory developments, and ensures training coverage across all staff.

We maintain mandatory privacy training for employees, contractors, and temporary workers with annual refreshers and scenario-based simulations. Access to production systems requires multi-factor authentication, device posture compliance, and completion of privacy awareness modules. Audit logs are monitored for anomalies, and breaches of this Policy may result in disciplinary action or termination of vendor contracts. These governance steps ensure that privacy is treated as a continuous operational responsibility.

sections.title: Personal data we collect
paragraphs: We collect personal data directly from users when they register accounts, build provider profiles, upload documentation, participate in marketing campaigns, or interact with customer success. This includes identity data (names, email addresses, phone numbers, postal addresses), professional information (trade qualifications, certifications, insurance details), and commercial data (bookings, invoices, fulfilment notes, dispute records). We also capture content users submit, such as messages, photos, videos, and digital signatures associated with jobs.

Automatically collected data includes device identifiers, browser types, session telemetry, crash diagnostics, IP addresses, approximate geolocation, security event metadata, and usage analytics captured through privacy-compliant instrumentation. We deploy cookies and similar technologies to maintain sessions, remember preferences, measure campaign effectiveness, and secure the platform. Sensitive data, such as biometric confirmations for field technicians or background screening results, is collected only where lawful and proportionate for the services delivered.

sections.title: Special category data
paragraphs: Fixnado does not routinely require special category data (such as racial or ethnic origin, political opinions, religious beliefs, trade union membership, genetic or biometric data, health data, or sexual orientation). However, certain engagements may involve health and safety contexts where limited health-related information is necessary to deliver a service or to comply with regulatory duties. When special category data is processed, we apply heightened safeguards, minimise the scope, and rely on explicit consent or applicable legal exemptions.

Background screening providers may share criminal conviction data or right-to-work verifications about providers where required by enterprise buyers or regulatory obligations. These checks are conducted under strict access controls, stored separately with encryption, and retained only for the period mandated by law or contract. Providers are informed about these checks in advance and may exercise their rights to access, correct, or challenge such records.

sections.title: Children's data
paragraphs: Fixnado is intended for professional use by adults. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children under 16, and our onboarding flows include age verification attestations. If we learn that personal data from a child has been inadvertently collected, we will delete the information promptly and take steps to prevent future collection. Parents or guardians who believe their child has provided information should contact privacy@fixnado.com so we can address the situation swiftly.

Where enterprise customers deliver services involving schools or youth facilities through Fixnado, they are responsible for ensuring appropriate consents and safeguards are in place. Blackwellen Ltd processes any related information strictly under the customer's instructions and applies contractual data processing controls, including restricted access, secure transmission, and deletion schedules aligned with safeguarding requirements.

sections.title: How we obtain personal data
paragraphs: We collect personal information directly from individuals, via forms, account portals, mobile interfaces, voice calls, emails, in-app chat, and integrated document uploads. We also receive data from third-party identity verification services, background check partners, credit reference agencies, open banking platforms, and logistics suppliers where such data is necessary to validate credentials, assess risk, or deliver services. Enterprise customers may supply workforce rosters, project site details, or escalation contacts under our processor role.

Fixnado gathers publicly available data such as professional registrations, safety certifications, and trade association listings to enrich provider profiles, subject to local laws. We may augment datasets with demographic or firmographic insights from reputable data brokers for marketing segmentation, but we require contractual assurances that these sources collected the data lawfully and with appropriate notice. Our procurement process includes data protection due diligence to ensure third-party sources adhere to equivalent privacy standards.

sections.title: Purposes of processing
paragraphs: Personal data is processed to deliver, personalise, and improve the Fixnado platform. This includes creating and managing accounts, authenticating users, matching providers with customer requests, facilitating bookings and escrow payments, dispatching field teams, enabling communication between parties, and providing customer support. We use analytics to understand feature adoption, measure service quality, detect fraud, and optimise logistics.

We also process data to meet legal obligations, including tax reporting, regulatory filings, anti-money laundering checks, workplace safety compliance, and responding to lawful requests from authorities. Marketing teams use personal data to deliver account-based campaigns, send product updates, and manage event invitations where permitted. When we process data for new purposes, we assess the compatibility with the original collection context, document the rationale, and update notices or seek consent where required.

sections.title: Lawful bases for processing
paragraphs: Under UK and EU data protection law, we rely on several lawful bases depending on the context: contractual necessity to provide services to customers and providers; legitimate interests to secure our systems, improve operations, and prevent fraud; compliance with legal obligations; and consent for specific marketing communications, cookies, or processing of special category data. When relying on legitimate interests, we perform a balancing test to confirm that our interests are not overridden by the rights and freedoms of data subjects.

Outside the UK and EU, we align with applicable local laws such as the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA), the Canadian Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA), and relevant state or provincial statutes. Where those regimes use different terminology, we map obligations to the closest GDPR-equivalent principle to maintain a consistent global standard. If consent is withdrawn, we cease processing for the relevant purpose unless another lawful basis applies.

sections.title: Automated decision-making and profiling
paragraphs: Fixnado uses automated systems to score provider responsiveness, assess booking risk, and suggest optimal technicians for a job. These models analyse data such as historical fulfilment rates, certification coverage, travel time predictions, pricing benchmarks, dispute history, telemetry readings, and safety incidents. Automated outcomes are monitored by operations specialists, and humans always retain the ability to override or adjust assignments. We do not deploy algorithms that produce significant legal effects without meaningful human involvement.

Customers and providers can request information about the logic involved in automated decisions that significantly affect them, and we will provide meaningful explanations within reasonable timeframes. Individuals may also contest automated outcomes by contacting support, at which point the case is escalated to a human reviewer. Models undergo bias testing, performance reviews, and data minimisation routines to reduce discriminatory impacts and ensure compliance with emerging AI regulations.

sections.title: Data retention
paragraphs: We retain personal data for as long as necessary to fulfil the purposes outlined in this Policy, to meet legal or accounting requirements, and to maintain accurate business records. Account data is preserved while an account remains active and for up to seven years after closure to comply with financial regulations, tax laws, and dispute resolution processes. Operational logs, telemetry, and audit trails are typically retained for 24 months unless extended to investigate security incidents or legal claims.

Retention schedules are documented within our records of processing activities and reviewed annually. When data is no longer required, it is securely deleted, anonymised, or archived with restricted access. Where customers administer their own data within the Fixnado enterprise panel, they can configure retention settings aligned with their internal policies, and we apply those settings as part of our processor obligations.

sections.title: International data transfers
paragraphs: Blackwellen Ltd stores data within the United Kingdom and European Economic Area by default, with resilient replicas in ISO 27001-certified data centres. When data is transferred outside these regions, we implement appropriate safeguards, including the UK International Data Transfer Agreement, EU Standard Contractual Clauses, and supplementary technical and organisational measures. Transfers to the United States leverage a combination of contractual commitments, encryption, and strict access controls.

We assess the legal environment of each destination and maintain a transfer register that documents the purposes, data categories, and safeguards applied. Where local laws may conflict with privacy protections, we evaluate the risk, provide transparency to customers, and implement additional controls such as pseudonymisation, key separation, and policy-based access restrictions. Users can request copies of transfer mechanisms by contacting the Privacy Office.

sections.title: Security measures
paragraphs: Security is integrated into Fixnado's product lifecycle. We employ encryption in transit (TLS 1.2+) and at rest (AES-256), zero-trust network segmentation, intrusion detection, and continuous vulnerability scanning. Multi-factor authentication, hardware-backed secrets, and device management enforce secure access to administrative tools. Our DevSecOps pipelines include static and dynamic code analysis, dependency monitoring, and secrets management to prevent leaks.

We conduct penetration tests at least annually, run bug bounty programs, and maintain 24/7 security operations coverage. Incident response playbooks define roles, escalation timelines, regulatory notification triggers, and customer communication pathways. Lessons learned feed back into security roadmaps, and we publish transparency reports summarising notable incidents and remedial steps without compromising confidentiality or security posture.

sections.title: Role-based access controls
paragraphs: Fixnado enforces role-based access controls (RBAC) that align with least privilege principles. System administrators can only view the data needed to fulfil operational duties, and access is reviewed quarterly. Provider-facing data is masked unless a workflow explicitly requires full visibility, such as verifying certifications or reconciling payments. Audit logs capture every access attempt and are subject to behavioural analytics to detect anomalies.

Enterprise customers can configure granular permissions within the Fixnado enterprise panel, defining scopes for procurement managers, site supervisors, finance approvers, and support agents. The mobile application mirrors these controls, ensuring that field teams only access job details relevant to their assignments. RBAC policies extend to third-party processors through contractual requirements and technical restrictions such as IP allowlists and segmented data stores.

sections.title: Individual rights
paragraphs: Depending on the jurisdiction, individuals may have rights to access, rectify, erase, restrict, or object to processing of their personal data, as well as the right to data portability and the right not to be subject to solely automated decisions. UK and EU residents enjoy these rights under GDPR; California residents have similar rights under CCPA/CPRA; Canadians under PIPEDA; and other regions may provide comparable protections. We honour verified rights requests within statutory timelines.

Residents of Brazil may exercise rights under the LGPD, including confirmation of processing and anonymisation of unnecessary data. Australian users can access and correct their data in accordance with the Privacy Act. Where local laws introduce new rights, we update our processes accordingly. We provide online tools to download data exports, correct profile information, and manage communication preferences, supplemented by human support channels for complex queries.

sections.title: How to exercise your rights
paragraphs: Users can submit privacy requests through the Fixnado Privacy Center, accessible via the web and mobile applications under Legal & Privacy settings. Requests require identity verification to protect accounts from unauthorised access. Verification methods may include confirmed email links, SMS codes, or secure identity documents processed through our KYC partners. We record each request in our compliance platform, assign a case owner, and provide progress updates.

Individuals may also contact us by email at privacy@fixnado.com or by mail to the Blackwellen Ltd Privacy Office, 14 Glasshouse Yard, London, EC1A 4JN, United Kingdom. If you are unsatisfied with our response, you have the right to lodge a complaint with your local supervisory authority. UK residents may contact the Information Commissioner's Office, and EU residents may contact their local Data Protection Authority. We cooperate fully with regulators and maintain audit trails of all interactions.

sections.title: Marketing communications
paragraphs: We send marketing communications to businesses and individuals who have opted in, signed up for webinars, downloaded resources, or engaged with our sales teams. Messages may include product updates, case studies, feature announcements, and event invitations tailored to industry interests. We honour marketing preferences stored in our consent management platform and provide unsubscribe links in every email. Opting out of marketing does not affect transactional or service communications required to operate your account.

We may use third-party marketing platforms that process limited personal data on our behalf. These partners are contractually bound to use the information only for Fixnado campaigns, to maintain confidentiality, and to delete data when campaigns conclude. We combine marketing analytics with product telemetry to measure conversion, but we use aggregated reporting whenever possible to avoid exposing identifiable behaviour beyond what is necessary.

sections.title: Cookies and tracking technologies
paragraphs: Our websites use cookies, SDKs, pixels, and similar technologies to maintain sessions, remember preferences, secure logins, and gather analytics about product usage. Essential cookies are required for core functionality and cannot be disabled, while performance, functional, and marketing cookies are optional. We provide a consent banner that allows users to accept or reject non-essential cookies granularly, and preferences are honoured across sessions through consent receipts stored server-side.

Mobile applications rely on secure storage rather than browser cookies, but we use equivalent technologies such as local secure preferences, device tokens, and telemetry identifiers. Users can reset identifiers from within the app's privacy settings, and mobile analytics respect system-level tracking preferences. We maintain a cookie and SDK register detailing each tracker, its purpose, retention period, and whether data is shared with third parties.

sections.title: Marketplace analytics and telemetry
paragraphs: Fixnado captures telemetry on marketplace performance, including service response times, escrow release metrics, material inventory turnover, and customer satisfaction scores. Data is pseudonymised wherever feasible, and identifiable reports are restricted to authorised teams. We aggregate metrics to inform product improvements, resource planning, and roadmap prioritisation. Telemetry dashboards available to enterprise customers respect role-based permissions and exclude data outside a customer's tenancy.

We partner with select analytics vendors who operate within secure environments and adhere to our data processing agreements. Logs are streamed using encrypted channels, and retention is governed by the schedules described earlier. Users can opt out of certain analytics via in-app controls, although critical telemetry necessary for security and service delivery will continue to be collected.

sections.title: Escrow and payments
paragraphs: Fixnado operates an escrow model to protect both customers and providers. Payment card details are processed by PCI DSS-compliant partners, and Fixnado never stores raw card numbers. We receive tokenised payment identifiers, transaction statuses, and settlement details to reconcile invoices and release funds when milestones are met. Bank account information for payouts is encrypted, access-controlled, and subject to fraud monitoring.

Anti-money laundering (AML) and know-your-customer (KYC) checks are conducted for providers and enterprise buyers in accordance with regulatory requirements. We share necessary information with payment processors, banks, and regulatory agencies to meet these obligations. Suspicious activity reports may be filed where legally required, and affected individuals may not be notified if prohibited by law. Payment records are retained for at least seven years to comply with financial legislation.

sections.title: Service provider and vendor obligations
paragraphs: Blackwellen Ltd engages carefully vetted processors to deliver infrastructure, identity verification, logistics, analytics, marketing, customer support, and professional services. Each vendor undergoes privacy and security due diligence, including review of certifications, penetration testing results, incident history, and sub-processor transparency. Contracts include confidentiality clauses, audit rights, breach notification obligations, and data return or destruction requirements upon termination.

Vendors receive only the data needed for their tasks, and we monitor compliance through attestations, technical integrations, and random inspections. Sub-processors must obtain our written approval before engaging additional subcontractors. A current list of processors is maintained at privacy.fixnado.com/subprocessors and includes transfer locations, purposes, and contact details for inquiries.

sections.title: Enterprise customer controls
paragraphs: Enterprise customers accessing the Fixnado panel can configure privacy settings for their organisation, including retention periods, redaction rules, masking levels, consent capture templates, and automated deletion workflows. Role administrators can assign privacy champions, integrate single sign-on, and enable multifactor enforcement for sensitive operations. Enterprise audit logs capture every data export, rights request, or policy override performed by customer administrators.

Fixnado supports data residency choices by allowing enterprise customers to select primary storage regions for their tenancy. Customers can trigger data exports in machine-readable formats, manage connected integrations, and configure policy-based access for external consultants. Where enterprise customers process employee data using Fixnado, they are responsible for providing appropriate notice to their staff and ensuring that their use of the platform complies with applicable labour and privacy laws.

sections.title: Data sharing and disclosures
paragraphs: We share personal data with trusted partners only when necessary to deliver services, comply with the law, or protect Fixnado, our users, and the public. Typical recipients include payment processors, logistics providers, credential verification services, cloud hosting providers, communications platforms, and professional advisors. When fulfilling enterprise programs, we may share provider contact details, qualifications, and availability with the relevant customer to enable project execution.

We may disclose information to competent authorities when legally required, such as responding to subpoenas, court orders, or lawful requests from government agencies. We evaluate each request for scope and legitimacy, and when permitted, we notify the affected individuals or customers. If Blackwellen Ltd is involved in a merger, acquisition, or asset sale, personal data may be transferred to the acquiring entity, and we will ensure the successor honours this Policy or provides equivalent protection.

sections.title: Integrations and third-party platforms
paragraphs: Fixnado offers integrations with project management tools, ERP systems, incident management platforms, customer success suites, and communications services. When users enable an integration, data flows between Fixnado and the third party according to user configuration. We recommend reviewing the privacy policies of each integration partner, as they act as independent controllers for the data they receive.

We provide granular scopes for OAuth connections and log every data exchange for auditability. Administrators can revoke integrations at any time through the enterprise panel or mobile application. If an integration provider experiences a security incident affecting shared data, they must notify Blackwellen Ltd without undue delay so we can support customer communications and remediation.

sections.title: Business insights and service improvement
paragraphs: We analyse aggregated marketplace data to identify service trends, workload patterns, and operational bottlenecks. Insights help us optimise routing algorithms, expand provider coverage, balance supply and demand, and enhance training modules. Aggregated reports may be shared with partners, investors, or public audiences, but individual identities are anonymised or aggregated to prevent re-identification.

Product teams run experiments and usability studies using pseudonymised datasets and obtain consent from participants where required. Feedback from surveys, support tickets, and interviews is catalogued in secure systems with access restricted to authorised personnel. When we publish testimonials or case studies, we obtain explicit permission and provide the option to revoke consent at any time.

sections.title: Incident response and breach notification
paragraphs: Our incident response plan defines detection, containment, eradication, recovery, and post-incident review stages. Cross-functional teams involving security, privacy, legal, engineering, and communications coordinate responses. We maintain standby agreements with forensic specialists and crisis communications partners to ensure rapid escalation. Simulated exercises run quarterly to validate readiness and to refine playbooks.

If an incident results in unauthorised access to personal data, we assess whether notification is required under applicable law. Where required, we notify regulators and affected individuals without undue delay, providing details about the nature of the incident, the data involved, the likely consequences, and steps taken to mitigate harm. We also provide recommendations for individuals to protect themselves and offer dedicated support channels for follow-up questions.

sections.title: Changes to this Policy
paragraphs: We may update this Privacy Policy to reflect changes in legislation, industry standards, or Fixnado's product portfolio. When significant updates are made, we will provide notice through in-app banners, email notifications, or administrative dashboards at least 14 days before the new version takes effect, unless immediate updates are required for legal compliance or security reasons. Historical versions are archived at privacy.fixnado.com/history for reference.

Continued use of Fixnado after a Policy update indicates acceptance of the revised terms. Users who do not agree with updates may deactivate their account or contact us to discuss available options. We encourage periodic review of this Policy to stay informed about how we protect personal data.

sections.title: Contacting us
paragraphs: For questions, feedback, or complaints about this Policy or our privacy practices, contact the Blackwellen Ltd Privacy Office at privacy@fixnado.com. Written correspondence may be sent to Blackwellen Ltd, Privacy Office, 14 Glasshouse Yard, London, EC1A 4JN, United Kingdom. We strive to respond to all inquiries within five business days and provide substantive responses within one calendar month.

EU residents may contact our appointed representative, DataTrust Europe GmbH, at Arnulfstrasse 21, 80335 Munich, Germany, or via eu-representative@datatrusteurope.eu. If your concerns remain unresolved, you may lodge a complaint with your local supervisory authority. A directory of authorities is available at privacy.fixnado.com/regulators.

sections.title: UK & EU supplemental notice
paragraphs: This supplement applies to individuals located in the United Kingdom or European Union. Blackwellen Ltd is the controller for data processed through Fixnado unless we act on behalf of an enterprise customer. Legal bases for processing are detailed earlier in this Policy. Data subjects have the right to lodge a complaint with their supervisory authority, request copies of Standard Contractual Clauses used for transfers, and object to processing based on legitimate interests. We will respond to rights requests within one month, extendable by two months for complex cases with notice.

For transfers to countries without an adequacy decision, we implement supplementary measures including encryption, pseudonymisation, and strict access controls. We do not engage in large-scale automated decision-making producing legal effects. Our DPO can be reached at dpo@blackwellen.com, and our EU representative may be contacted as described above.

sections.title: United States supplemental notice
paragraphs: For residents of the United States, particularly California, Colorado, Connecticut, Utah, and Virginia, you may have rights to know what personal information we collect, request deletion, opt out of the sale or sharing of personal information, and limit the use of sensitive data. Fixnado does not sell personal information for monetary value, but we may share data for cross-context behavioural advertising with consent. You can exercise these rights via the Privacy Center or by calling our toll-free number at +1 (877) 555-0199.

We respond to verifiable requests within 45 days, extendable once with notice. We will not discriminate against you for exercising your privacy rights. Authorised agents may submit requests on your behalf with written permission or power of attorney documentation. In the event of a conflict between US state laws and this Policy, we comply with the stricter requirement.

sections.title: Canada supplemental notice
paragraphs: Canadian residents benefit from protections under PIPEDA and provincial privacy laws. We obtain meaningful consent for the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information, and we limit data handling to what a reasonable person would consider appropriate in the circumstances. Individuals may request access to their personal information, challenge accuracy, and withdraw consent subject to legal or contractual restrictions.

Cross-border transfers to our UK or EU infrastructure are permitted under PIPEDA, and we ensure comparable safeguards for any processing conducted outside Canada. Complaints may be submitted to the Office of the Privacy Commissioner of Canada if you are unsatisfied with our response.

sections.title: Asia-Pacific supplemental notice
paragraphs: For individuals in Australia, New Zealand, Singapore, and other Asia-Pacific jurisdictions, we comply with applicable privacy laws such as the Australian Privacy Act, New Zealand Privacy Act, and Singapore Personal Data Protection Act. We rely on consent or contractual necessity where required and provide mechanisms to access and correct personal information. Data may be transferred to our UK or EU infrastructure, and we ensure the recipient provides comparable safeguards.

If you have complaints in Australia, you may contact the Office of the Australian Information Commissioner. Singapore residents may reach the Personal Data Protection Commission. Our regional privacy liaison can be contacted at apac-privacy@fixnado.com for tailored assistance.

sections.title: Glossary
paragraphs: Accountability principle: Organisations must take responsibility for compliance with privacy principles and demonstrate that compliance. Anonymisation: Irreversibly removing identifiers so data can no longer be linked to an individual. Data controller: The entity that determines the purposes and means of processing personal data. Data processor: An entity that processes personal data on behalf of a controller. Data Protection Impact Assessment (DPIA): A structured review that evaluates risks arising from processing operations and identifies mitigation steps.

Personal data: Any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person. Pseudonymisation: Processing data in such a way that it can no longer be attributed to a specific individual without additional information kept separately. Special category data: Sensitive data requiring additional safeguards, including health, biometric, or racial data. Standard Contractual Clauses: Legal mechanisms approved by the European Commission to legitimise international data transfers.
